alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 2:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, West Ashley, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, James Island, Johns Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Charles Towne Landing, Magnolia Gardens, Charleston Naval Complex, Don Holt Bridge, Westmoreland Bridge, Citadel Mall, Oakland, Maryville, Shadowmoss and Saint Andrews.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
